content: Another small bit of celebration for Dana Scott's 90th Birthday: the Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic (PSSL) is an informal meeting of categorists, type theorists and logicians, started in 1976 by Dana Scott, while in Oxford. There's now an nLab page, but we only have the titles of the talks till the 100th PSSL. We're missing at least 5 meetings and help providing webpages or listings of the talks for these missing meetings would be much appreciated!

There have been 6 meetings since PSSL 100.

  • PSSL 101: https://web.archive.org/web/20180831143433/http://www1.maths.leeds.ac.uk/~pmtng/PSSL/pssl101.html
  • PSSL 102: https://www.usc.es/regaca/pssl102/
  • PSSL 103: See message below
  • PSSL 104: https://mysite.science.uottawa.ca/phofstra/PSSL18.html
  • PSSL 105: https://sites.google.com/view/pssl-105
  • PSSL 106: http://www.math.muni.cz/~bourkej/PSSL106.html

By the way, for later PSSL meetings, it's possible to find talk abstracts as well as talk titles. It would be nice to include these in the document for archival purposes (or perhaps directly on the nLab).
Great @Nathanael Arkor ! but why didn't you add this directly to the nLab? I thought this was the point of the nLab?

@Valeria de Paiva: the contents of the PSSL history document are not on the nLab. I thought whoever was responsible for that document would want to update it. I agree it would be nice if the contents were available on the nLab directly, though.

The file was produced by Dr Julia Goedecke, a former student of PTJ, who, as far as I know, is not in this zulip. I don't have the latex source for it. If I had, I would've put it in GitHub, as there are titles missing, and it would indeed be nice to have abstracts for all possible talks.
I added the links from @Nathanael Arkor to the nLab page
Hi @Valeria de Paiva , I organized PSSL105 in Palermo. Abstracts of the talks are on the website, however here they are: pssl_105_programme_with_abstracts.pdf
Please tell me if you need anything else.

Many thanks Beppe! but why don't you just add it to the nLab page? very
best,
Valeria

Valeria de Paiva said:

Another small bit of celebration for Dana Scott's 90th Birthday: the Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic (PSSL) is an informal meeting of categorists, type theorists and logicians, started in 1976 by Dana Scott, while in Oxford. There's now an nLab page, but we only have the titles of the talks till the 100th PSSL. We're missing at least 5 meetings and help providing webpages or listings of the talks for these missing meetings would be much appreciated!

oops - page not found!
This zulip has a nice syntax extension where you can just type the name of an nLab page in double-brackets, like you do on the nLab itself: [[Peripatetic Seminar on Sheaves and Logic]].
Thanks @Beppe Metere and thanks @Jean-Baptiste Vienney for adding information to the page!
And thanks @Steve Awodey and @Mike Shulman for correcting the link!
